result.execSummary:
The defendant Devarrio D Ward was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions of Probation if revoked.
Court allows transfer to the State of Georgia.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
Obtain GED/HSED.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
No contact with any of the co-defendant's or businesses listed in the Criminal Complaint.
No to use/possess checks/checking account (unless payroll check made out to him).
No to leave the State of Georgia unless permission from Agent is granted.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with Standard Release Conditions.
Apply 120 days sentence credit.
LAST 60 DAYS STAYED.  To be used at Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: filed by the state
of Special Agent Theresa Williams testimony/statements from sentencing held on August 7, 2015 for Desmond Harris (Co-Defendant).
from Defendant filed by Attorney Penegor

Defendant Devarrio D Ward in court, in custody, with Attorney Robert J. Penegor.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Penegor makes statements regarding sentencing. Penny W. makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

42 MONTHS IMPRISONMENT 
  -  18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -   2  YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS       *Transfer allowed to State of Georgia**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling - obtain GED/HSED
____No contact with: Co-Defendant's listed in criminal complaint or businesses listed in criminal
____Not to use/possess checks/checking account (unless payroll check made out to him) 
____Not to leave State of Georgia unless permission from agent is granted
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done

COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME: 180 Days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions (120 Days credit) - LAST 60 DAYS STAYED - to be used agent's discretion   

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing hearing on August 27, 2015 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Devarrio D Ward in court, in custody, with attorney Robert J. Penegor.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds defendant guilty of count #1.  Counts's number 2-8 are dismissed and read in.  Attorney Penegor requests a quick sentencing date.    Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 11:00 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Devarrio D Ward in court, in custody, with Attorney Eric Lowenberg for Attorney Robert J. Penegor.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This case is called with Case #15CF542, 15CF544, 15CF545 and 15CF539.  All attorneys on all cases are present (Attorney Kirk Redetzke appears by telephone).   Court advises all parties of anticipated timeline for jury trial commencing on Monday, August 10, 2015.  Court orders counsels to submit proposed jury instructions to the court by 8/6/15 status date.  Court orders/requests all counsel to submit their proposed questions to jury panel by 8/6/15, as well as an approximate estimate of time on opening/closing statements.  Court states all exhibits should be marked before jury trial and requests parties to use projector/doc cam to show exhibits during trial.  Court reminds parties to provide street clothes for their clients for trial day (days).
